alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 12 at 2:07AM PDT until March 14 at 2:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The southern Oregon Cascades north of Howard Prairie, including Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, and portions of highways 140, 62, 138, 58 and 230. * WHEN...From late Monday morning through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Low visibilities are possible due to blowing and drifting snow. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
